intro: Tovomita silvatica, commonly known as the forest tovomita, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
